attributes.action: It is No Brainer that HMG should not make agreements, contracts to dictated to by other governments that is not in UK’s best interests
attributes.additional_details: UK should not ‘shoot herself in the foot’. Rights conferred to another states (like EU), if not renewed/negotiated from time to time by a sovereign state may be taken for granted to be permanent by stealthy ‘prescription’ (a Land Law concept). All EU agreements should not be assumed permanent and should be renewed, renegotiated, amended or annulled every decade (say). Grants of rights under EU treaties give the impression that they are there for perpetuity. Under Land Law, the right of private way (easements) over another's land may arise from prescription by twenty years of continuous use of a land by implied easement. What rights is given away by a sovereign state should be able to be returned back to the state, unless it is by military conquest as in 1066 by William the Conquer.
